subject: Re: [junit] JUnit and Ant: stack trace filtering
msgSnippet: Just a question about the JUnit Ant Task itself... I ve just started using it, and one of my tests failed (I knew it would). But, Ant never told me which test
messageBody:
Just a question about the JUnit Ant Task itself...

I've just started using it, and one of my tests failed (I knew it would).
But, Ant never told me which test failed, it said which TestCase failed,
but not the actual test. This was using the plain layout, using the XML
layout I saw it added alot more detail about everything it did. If you're
submitting a new version, wanna see if you could add a message to say which
test failed on the plain (and maybe brief) layouts?

Mmmm, or maybe I should check out a recent cvs version first and see if its
already fixed....

--On Wednesday, December 05, 2001 12:21:28 -0500 Scott Stirling
<sstirling@...> wrote:

> I modified the Ant JUnit task to support this functionality. Would
> appreciate it if a couple more people tried it out before I submit it to
> Jakarta. I've been using it in some of our build projects here with no
